form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Flake (for himself, Mr. McCain, Mr. Risch, Mr. Wicker, Mr. Crapo, Mr. Sessions, Mr. Johnson of Wisconsin, Mr. Vitter, Mr. Enzi, Mr. Barrasso, Mr. Coats, Mr. Cornyn, and Mr. Thune) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works

form.official-title: To amend the Clean Air Act to delay the review and revision of the national ambient air quality standards for ozone.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Ozone Regulatory Delay and Extension of Assessment Length Act of 2014 or the ORDEAL Act of 2014.
Section 109(d) of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7409(d)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the first sentence, by striking (d)(1) Not later than December 31, 1980, and at five-year intervals and inserting the following:

subsection.header: Review and revision of criteria and standards; independent scientific review committee; appointment; advisory functions

paragraph.header: Review and revision of criteria and standards

subparagraph.text: Except as provided in subparagraph (C), not later than December 31, 1980, and at 10-year intervals
in the second sentence, by striking The Administrator and inserting the following:

subparagraph.header: Early and frequent review and revision
subparagraph.text: Except with respect to any national ambient air quality standard promulgated under this section for ozone concentrations, the Administrator
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.header: National ambient air quality standards for ozone concentrations
subparagraph.text: Not earlier than February 1, 2018, but not later than December 31, 2018, and at 10-year intervals thereafter, the Administrator shall, with respect to national ambient air quality standards for ozone concentrations—

clause.text: complete a thorough review of any standard promulgated under this section; and
make revisions to the standards described in clause (i) and promulgate new standards as may be appropriate in accordance with section 108 and subsection (b).

subparagraph.text: by striking (B) Not later than January 1, 1980, and at five-year intervals and inserting the following:

clause.text: Except as provided in clause (ii), not later than January 1, 1980, and at 10-year intervals

subparagraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

clause.header: National ambient air quality standards for ozone concentrations
clause.text: Not earlier than February 1, 2018, and at 10-year intervals thereafter, the committee referred to in subparagraph (A) shall, with respect to national ambient air quality standards for ozone concentrations—

subclause.text: complete a review of any standard promulgated under this section; and
recommend to the Administrator any new standard and any revision to the standards described in subclause (I) as may be appropriate under section 108 and subsection (b).
